final_explanation: Let x be the number of 5 € bills, y be the number of 10 € bills, and z be the number of 20 € bills. We have two equations: x + y + z = 20 (total number of bills) and 5x + 10y + 20z = 200 (total value of the bills). Solving these equations, we can substitute y = 20 - x - z into the second equation: 5x + 10(20 - x - z) + 20z = 200. Simplifying, we get 5x + 200 - 10x - 10z + 20z = 200, which simplifies to -5x + 10z = 0. Thus, x = 2z. Substituting x = 2z into x + y + z = 20 gives 2z + y + z = 20, or 3z + y = 20. Substituting x = 2z into 5x + 10y + 20z = 200 gives 10z + 10y + 20z = 200, or 30z + 10y = 200. Solving these two equations, we find z = 6, y = 2, and x = 12. Par conséquent, there are 6 bills of 20 €.
